feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 1:50PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and gusty winds tonight... Snow will move into the area this evening with 2 to 4 inches of additional accumulation. West to northwest winds will increase to 5 to 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph. Gusty winds may blow snow off trees, or blow trees laden with snow, on to power lines creating power outages.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 5:06AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE SUSITNA VALLEY MONDAY... Snow is expected to develop Monday morning across much of the Susitna Valley. The snow is expected to start off as wet snow before transitioning to a drier, more powdery snow by Monday afternoon or evening. Snowfall rates are also expected to increase late Monday, especially along the Parks Highway from Talkeetna

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 5:03AM AKST until December 20 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain mixed with snow occasionally. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Highest snow amounts from Sterling east. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula.

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Visibility may drop as low as one quarter mile or less at times due to resuspension of snow that has already fallen.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued December 20 at 9:10AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surfs of 9 to 11 feet will impact all shores of American Samoa due to a long period (>15 seconds) northwest swell. * TIMING...through this evening. * IMPACTS...High surfs and strong rip currents Fautuaga mo galu maualuluga

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 3:04PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER WILL RESULT IN MAJOR TRAVEL DISRUPTIONS MID WEEK THROUGH THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada this week. There will be few meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin late Tuesday so plan ahead.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 2:52PM PST until December 23 at 4:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches possible with localized amounts up to 24 inches over higher remote terrain. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph over exposed terrain.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County

entry.summary: ...Multiple Winter Storms to Impact Holiday Mountain Travel Tuesday through the Weekend... .A series of winter storms will bring multiple rounds of mountain snow and gusty winds Tuesday through Sunday. entry.summary: ...AN AIR QUALITY ADVISORY HAS BEEN ISSUED BY THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY... Due to elevated pollutant levels, the air quality has become unhealthy for sensitive groups in Franklin County. This advisory will remain in effect until air quality has significantly improved.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 2:54PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG LATER TONIGHT... Fog will develop late tonight into Tuesday morning...mainly along and south of a Watseka to Springfield line. The fog may become locally dense. With overnight low temperatures dropping well below freezing into the middle 20s, scattered slick spots will be possible on area roadways...particularly bridges and overpasses.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 3:04PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER WILL RESULT IN MAJOR TRAVEL DISRUPTIONS MID WEEK THROUGH THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada this week. There will be few meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin late Tuesday so plan ahead.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 3:47AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER WILL RESULT IN MAJOR TRAVEL DISRUPTIONS MID WEEK THROUGH THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada this week. There will be few, if any, meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin on Tuesday, so plan ahead.
